verses.kjv: I will praise thee, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.
verses.ct: LORD, I will praise you with everything in me; I will tell about all your amazing deeds.

verses.kjv: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.
verses.ct: I will celebrate and find my joy in you; I will sing praises to your name, Most High.

verses.kjv: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
verses.ct: When my enemies retreat, they stumble and are destroyed in your presence.

verses.kjv: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.
verses.ct: You have upheld my cause and defended my case; you sat on your throne and judged with justice.

verses.kjv: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.
verses.ct: You have confronted the nations, wiped out the wicked, and erased their names permanently.

verses.kjv: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.
verses.ct: The enemy is finished — ruined forever! You tore down their cities, and every trace of them has vanished.

verses.kjv: But the LORD shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.
verses.ct: But the LORD remains forever; he has established his throne for judgment.

verses.kjv: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.
verses.ct: He will judge the world with righteousness and govern the peoples with fairness.

verses.kjv: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.
verses.ct: The LORD will also be a safe place for the oppressed, a shelter during times of trouble.

verses.kjv: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.
verses.ct: Those who recognize who you are will trust in you, because you, LORD, have never abandoned those who look to you.

verses.kjv: Sing praises to the LORD, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.
verses.ct: Sing praises to the LORD, who lives in Zion; proclaim what he has done among the nations.

verses.kjv: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.
verses.ct: When he investigates bloodshed, he remembers the victims; he does not ignore the cry of those who are suffering.

verses.kjv: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:
verses.ct: Show me mercy, LORD; see how I am afflicted by those who hate me — you are the one who pulls me back from the edge of death.

verses.kjv: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.
verses.ct: Then I can declare all your praises at the gates of Jerusalem; I will celebrate your salvation.

verses.kjv: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
verses.ct: The nations have fallen into the very pit they dug; their own feet are caught in the trap they set.

verses.kjv: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.
verses.ct: The LORD has revealed himself through his justice; the wicked are trapped by the work of their own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

verses.kjv: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.
verses.ct: The wicked will be sent to the grave, along with every nation that ignores God.

verses.kjv: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.
verses.ct: The needy will not always be overlooked, and the hope of the poor will not be crushed forever.

verses.kjv: Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
verses.ct: Rise up, LORD! Don't let mere humans triumph; let the nations be judged in your presence.

verses.kjv: Put them in fear, O LORD: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.
verses.ct: Strike them with awe, LORD, so the nations will realize they are only human. Selah.
